title: Torque on a spool of thread

content.question: A spool is made of two circular disks connected to the ends of a cylinder so that the centers of the disks and the cylinder are aligned. In the figure above, the cylinder is shown as the dashed circle, and the disk on one end of the cylinder is shown as the larger solid circle. The spool is at rest on a level horizontal surface. A string attached to the cylinder is pulled gently so that the spool can rotate without slipping on the surface at point P. A force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is pulled in the direction of arrow <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the spool spins but does not roll across the table. If the string is pulled with a force of <math alttext="2 F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the directions indicated, if any, indicates a pull on the string that will cause the spool to spin but not roll across the table?

choices.label: The spool will roll on the table for all four directions shown.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
